com.lacunasoftware.restpki

Class SignatureFinisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lacunasoftware.restpki.SignatureFinisher
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CadesSignatureFinisher, PadesSignatureFinisher, XmlSignatureFinisher

    public abstract class SignatureFinisher
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for PadesSignatureFinisher and CadesSignatureFinisher

      abstract byte[] finish()
      Performs the step (should only be called after calling setToken()).

      Returns information about the signer's certificate (can only be called after calling the finish() method).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SignatureFinisher

        public SignatureFinisher(RestPkiClient client)

    • Method Detail

      • setToken

        public void setToken(java.lang.String token)
        Sets the token previously yielded by the first step.
        Parameters:
        token - The token, a 43-character case-sensitive string containing only letters, numbers and the characters "-" and "_" (therefore URL and HTML safe).

      • setSignature

        public void setSignature(java.lang.String signature)
        Sets the signature performed using the user certificate's private key (should not be used if the signature was started with the method startWithWebPki).
        Parameters:
        signature - The signature operation output, encoded in Base64 (this is the format returned by the Web PKI component's signData and signHash methods).

      • finish

        public abstract byte[] finish()
                       throws RestException
        Performs the step (should only be called after calling setToken()). This method throws a ValidationException if the validation of the signature or of the user's certificate fails.
        Returns:
        The signature result (for PadesSignatureFinisher, the signed PDF's bytes, for CadesSignatureFinisher, the CMS's bytes)
        Throws:
        RestException - If an error occurs while calling the REST PKI API or if validation of the signature or of the user's certificate fails.

      • getCallbackArgument

        public java.lang.String getCallbackArgument()
        Returns the callback argument, if one was passed during the first step (must only be called after calling the finish() method).
        Returns:
        The callback argument passed previously on the first step, or null if no argument was passed.

      • getCertificateInfo

        public PKCertificate getCertificateInfo()
        Returns information about the signer's certificate (can only be called after calling the finish() method).
        Returns:
        The signer's certificate information.
